mdRecord.dcterms:description: Formerly a block house of individual tenements, the building at 614 East 113th Street was converted into a Masonic Hall after the Pullman Land Association sold the Pullman Companyâ€™s residential property. A large auditorium was carved out of the upper floors. Owned by the Historic Pullman Foundation since 1973, the building is known as the Historic Pullman Center and hosts meetings and offices. The building also provides storage for the Historic Pullman Foundation collections. Exterior restoration work was completed in 2012. -- http://www.pullmanil.org/FINAL_Pullman%20Historic%20District%20Reconnaissance%20Survey_July%202013%20Small.pdf [work]
